response.answer_text: Assume nothing Believe nobody Confirm everything You must go into an investigation with an open mind. Any policy decisions you make should be noted in a policy book together with reasons at the time you make them. When you end up in the High Court in the Strand, London 6 years later having a policy book to rely on will be of great assistance when you are cross examined. There is an old saying in British policing “ if it isn't written down,it didn't happen" Picture the scene. You are the senior investigating officer at the assassination of an informant in a supermarket car park. First entry in the policy book could read: “I have assumed the role of SIO and l am treating this incident as a murder because: The victim is deceased as confirmed by Dr Jones, There appears to be a gunshot wound behind the victims left ear No firearm is present suggesting that the offender took it with him and that this is not a suicide Decision made at noon hours Day Date, place” You have now set the early parameters fo your investigation
